title: Fire hits downtown Dover apartment building
content: 5:39PM     Fire crews work to douse a 3-alarm blaze on Second Street in Dover Saturday afternoon.  (COURTESY SOMERSWORTH FIREFIGHTERS)     DOVER - Firefighters from several communities helped city first responders battle a three-alarm fire Saturday afternoon.   The blaze broke out in the second-floor apartment of the two-and-a-half-story building at 22-1/2 Second St., one block west of Main Street.   Heavy fire was reported when firefighters first arrived just after 3 p.m.   The fire was reported contained just after 4:10 p.m. but Dover and Somersworth fire crews remained for clean up.   Rochester, Durham and Portsmouth were among communities that offered assistance.   The building sustained significant fire and smoke damage, especially to the rear of the structure.   There were no reports of injuries and fire officials said they were still investigating the cause.    Fires  Dover
